member.summary: Get a pointer to the underlying raw binary blob. Take caution when accessing data with the raw pointer, as no boundary checks are employed, and improper operations will cause data corruption and/or system crash.

member.name: P:TriSQL.ElementCell_Accessor.CellSize
member.summary: Get the size of the cell content, in bytes.

member.name: P:TriSQL.ElementCell_Accessor.CellID
member.summary: Get the cell id. The value can be null when the id is undefined.

member.summary: Represents a writer accessor on the message of type UpdateTableMessage defined in the TSL protocols. The message writers should be instantiated by the user's logic and passed to the system to send it out. After finished accessing the message. member.name: M:TriSQL.StorageExtension_DatabaseCell.UseDatabaseCell(Trinity.Storage.LocalMemoryStorage,System.Int64,Trinity.TSL.Lib.CellAccessOptions)
member.summary: Allocate a cell accessor on the specified cell, which inteprets the cell as a DatabaseCell. Any changes done to the accessor are written to the storage immediately. If == false, on calling this method, it attempts to acquire the lock of the cell, and blocks until it gets the lock. Otherwise this method is wait-free.
member.param: A instance.
The id of the specified cell.
Specifies write-ahead logging behavior. Valid values are CellAccessOptions.StrongLogAhead(default) and CellAccessOptions.WeakLogAhead. Other values are ignored.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: M:TriSQL.GenericCellOperations.SaveGenericCell(Trinity.Storage.MemoryCloud,Trinity.Storage.ICell)
member.summary: Adds a new cell to the key-value store if the cell Id does not exist, or updates an existing cell in the key-value store if the cell Id already exists. Note that the generic cell will be saved as a strongly typed cell. It can then be loaded into either a strongly-typed cell or a generic cell.
member.param: A instance.
The cell to be saved.

member.name: T:TriSQL.Index
member.summary: Provides indexing capabilities on . The target field to query on is specified with , .

member.name: M:TriSQL.Index.SubstringQuery(TriSQL.Index.IndexIdentifier,System.String)
member.summary: Performs a substring query on . The target field to query on is specified with , .
member.param: The identifier of the field that the query should be performed on.
The query string.
member.returns: A list of cell ids, of which the given query string is a substring of the field, or a substring of an element if the target field is a container of strings.

member.name: M:TriSQL.Index.SubstringQuery(TriSQL.Index.IndexIdentifier,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary:
Performs a substring sequence query on . The semantics of this type of query is that, given a sequence of query strings q_1, q_2,...,q_n in , the match condition on a target string is that all the strings in the sequence are the substrings of the target string, and the order of the substring occurances should correspond strictly to that given by . For example (let S denote the target string):
S=..q1....q2..q3{and so on}...qn... is a match.
S=.....q1q2..q4{and there are missing substrings in the sequence}...qn... is not match.
S=..q5..q3.q1{all the substrings in the sequence are present, but never in the corresponding order}...qn... is not match.
The target field to query on is specified with , .
member.param: The identifier of the field that the query should be performed on.
The sequence of query strings.
member.returns: A list of cell ids, of which the given query string sequence is matched on the target field, or an element it if it is a container of strings.

member.name: M:TriSQL.Index.SubstringQuery(TriSQL.Index.IndexIdentifier,System.String[])
member.summary:
Performs a substring sequence query on . The semantics of this type of query is that, given a sequence of query strings q_1, q_2,...,q_n in , the match condition on a target string is that all the strings in the sequence are the substrings of the target string, and the order of the substring occurances should correspond strictly to that given by . For example (let S denote the target string):
S=..q1....q2..q3{and so on}...qn... is a match.
S=.....q1q2..q4{and there are missing substrings in the sequence}...qn... is not match.
S=..q5..q3.q1{all the substrings in the sequence are present, but never in the corresponding order}...qn... is not match.
The target field to query on is specified with , .
member.param: The identifier of the field that the query should be performed on.
The sequence of query strings.
member.returns: A list of cell ids, of which the given query string sequence is matched on the target field, or an element it if it is a container of strings.

member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the date and time contained in s, if the conversion succeeded, or if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is an empty string (""), or does not contain a valid string representation of a date and time. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the s parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
